colors.title: OBE:BS4 COLORS
colors.description: A customized Bootstrap 4 SASS build focused on integrating a full illustration color wheel palette into Bootstrap 4 elements, components and conventions.

extensions.title: OBE:BS4 EXTENSIONS
extensions.description: Extended Bootstrap 4 classes, elements and components to add more definitive and design-orientated functionalities to any Bootstrap 4 project.

sections.head: Project
sections.subhead: F O N T S
sections.descrip: These are your standard text colors.

sections.head: Font
sections.subhead: W E I G H T S
sections.descrip: These are your project font weight classes. Please note they are only available based on the Google Font weights you specified in your settings.

sections.head: Border
sections.subhead: W I D T H S
sections.descrip: These are your expanded border widths.

sections.head: Box

sections.subhead: H E I G H T S

sections.head: Material Design
sections.subhead: T E X T - I N P U T S
sections.descrip: These are form elements that leverage Google's Material Design guidelines using the Bootstrap 4 styled naming conventions and utilities.

sections.head: Modal
sections.subhead: U T I L I T I E S
sections.descrip: These are a set of modal utility classes and options that will allow you to use modals more creatively and impactfully.

sections.head: Opacity
sections.subhead: U T I L I T I E S
sections.descrip: These are opacity classes to allow for an artistic range of color blending possibilities.

sections.head: Fab
sections.subhead: B U T T O N S
sections.descrip: These are your fab button options. Fab buttons have equal heights and widths and generally have a single character or icon in them. Fab buttons come in three basic shapes: Round Corner, Square Corner, and Circle.

sections.head: Off-Canvas Nav
sections.subhead: M O D A L S
sections.descrip: These are a pinned modals speficically setup for use as navigaiton components for a project.

sections.head: Dropdown Select
sections.subhead: C O M P O N E N T - P L U G I N
sections.descrip: These are examples of different custom dropdown select components. These use the Bootstrap 4 dropdown menu functionality, and some custom scripting allowing the component to visually simulate a select element by using a hidden form input element in place of a traditional select element. You can either use the default markup which instantiates the plugin automatically when using a '.dropdown-select' set of classes (perfect for using a dropdown select instead of a standard select.) Conversely, you can instantiate the plugin on your own component with your own classes, event names, selectors, and more. Using this method, you can also add/use multiple data attributes on each dropdown select option! ;)

sections.head: Calendar Date Picker
sections.subhead: C O M P O N E N T - P L U G I N
sections.descrip: These are examples of different uses of the OBE:BS4 Calendar Datepicker Plugin. You can use these components to enhance the user experience whenever you need a user to specify a date in your application.

sections.head: Toggle Text
sections.subhead: M I N I - P L U G I N
sections.descrip: A simple plugin that adds the ability to dynamically toggle text by adding a single data atrribute and value on an element.

icons.title: OBE:BS4 ICONS
icons.description: A set of default FontAwesome 5 elements and components, formatted exclusively with  FontAwesome 5 and Bootstrap 4 classes.

sections.head: Icon
sections.subhead: S I Z E S
sections.descrip: These are the FontAwesome 5 relative icons sizes. These sizes are relative to the parent element, and go up to a maximum of 10x bigger, relatively.

sections.head: Icon
sections.subhead: B O R D E R S
sections.descrip: These are your FontAwesome 5 border options.

sections.head: Icon
sections.subhead: F L O A T S
sections.descrip: These are your FontAwesome 5 float options.

sections.head: Fixed Width
sections.subhead: I C O N S
sections.descrip: This is how you use fixed width FontAwesome 5 icons (mainly for lists and navigation elements.)

sections.head: Icon
sections.subhead: O R I E N T A T I O N
sections.descrip: This is how you can control the rotation of FontAwesome 5 icons.

sections.head: Shrink & Grow
sections.subhead: T R A N S F O R M S
sections.descrip: These examples demonstrate how shrink or increase the size of your icons (in context of the parent element) when the FontAwesome 5 JavaScript kicks in. NOTE: You can use any number (including decimals) to change the size. Each interger represents a 1/16em unit.

sections.head: Positioning
sections.subhead: T R A N S F O R M S
sections.descrip: These examples demonstrate how to position your icons (in context of the parent element) when the FontAwesome 5 JavaScript kicks in. NOTE: You can use any number (including decimals) to change the size. Each interger represents a 1/16em unit.

sections.head: Rotate & Flip
sections.subhead: T R A N S F O R M S
sections.descrip: These examples demonstrate how rotate or flip the orientation of your icons (in context of the parent element) when the FontAwesome 5 JavaScript kicks in. NOTE: You can use any number (including negative values) to change the orientation. Each interger represents a single degree unit.

sections.head: Masking
sections.subhead: I C O N S
sections.descrip: These examples demonstrate how to combine two icons, where one icon knocks-out the other icon when the FontAwesome 5 JavaScript kicks in. NOTE: This allows you to show the background color underneath the resulting SVG where any fill was knocked-out.

sections.head: Icon
sections.subhead: L A Y E R I N G
sections.descrip: These examples demonstrate how to layer mulitple icons on top of each other, and with each icon having independent colors.

sections.head: Stacked
sections.subhead: I C O N S
sections.descrip: These are examples of stacked FontAwesome 5 icons.

sections.head: Icon
sections.subhead: A N I M A T I O N S
sections.descrip: These are your FontAwesome 5 animation options.

sections.head: Dynamic Icon Swap
sections.subhead: S C R I P T
sections.descrip: This script technique is necessary to do any user interaction based changes to any FontAwesome 5 icons (due to the JS/SVG rendering process upon a page load).

sections.head: Bullets & Lists
sections.subhead: I C O N S
sections.descrip: This is how you use FontAwesome 5 utility classes to make icons act as bullets for list elements (which include the fixed width FontAwesome CSS, too!)

sections.head: Animated Checkbox
sections.subhead: I C O N S
sections.descrip: These are examples of animated icon checkbox elements that you can use in web forms or for general user interactions.

reference.title: OBE:BS4 REFERENCE
reference.description: Sortable and filterable tables of color space codes and Bootstrap 4 classes that are used throughout your library.

sections.head: Color Codes
sections.subhead: T A B L E
sections.descrip: Use the input to search and the column headers to sort!

sections.head: Print Display
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to ensure that specific content is displayed when a user opts to print something they are viewing in a browser.

sections.head: Navbar Responsive
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to specify the breakpoint that triggers a navbar to collapse into its hidden/mobile state.

sections.head: Display
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how content should be displayed depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

sections.head: Flex Direction
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should flow depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

sections.head: Flex Justification
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should be aligned depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

sections.head: Flex Vertical Alignment
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should be vertically aligned depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

sections.head: Flex Self Alignment
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should vertically align itself depending on responsive breakpoints as needed.

sections.head: Flex Fill
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should fill all the horizontal space that is available.

sections.head: Flex Grow & Shrink
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to set when and how flexbox content should collapse or expand based on the surrounding flex content.

sections.head: Auto Margin
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S

sections.head: Flex Align Content

sections.head: Accessing OBE:BS4 Colors
sections.subhead: J A V A S C R I P T
sections.descrip: If you need to access any OBE:BS4 color values in JavaScript, you can use these handy JSON strings to bring those values into your application. You can either choose a single color space type or bring them all! NOTE: To use RGBa values in JavaScript, be sure to copy our utility function that will allow you to change the alpha value for any color value, to whatever alpha value you need. The defalut alpha value for each RGBa color value string defaluts to a string of '0.5', so you can replace that exact string with your custom alpha value.

sections.head: Float Utility
sections.subhead: C L A S S E S
sections.descrip: Use these classes to float content which allows for other content like text to flow around the floated element(s).

sections.subhead: C L A S S E S

boilerplates.title: OBE:BS4 BOILERS
boilerplates.description: A set of boilerplates that are based on your settings and fonts choices, and can be used for various design and development circumstances.

settings.title: OBE:BS4 SETTINGS
